reviews.review:
Me at 3 A.M.: "Alright, maybe one more match."
(3 hours later)
6 A.M.: "Oh god, what have I become!"
10/10 would do another round again.

After the release of Doom 3 and in anticipation of Half-Life 2 and S.T.A.L.K.E.R. conversations about the graph in relation to Counter-Strike may look somewhat naive. That's why we will not dwell too much on this issue - you can see a lot from the screenshots, and even more - after trying Counter-Strike: Source in the case. The only thing I want to say is that CS: S looks more than modern and will not cause indignation even for the most pretentious player, while the majority are guaranteed to just be delighted.

Revived environment

When you first start the game, you will be amazed at how clearly and harmoniously the world around you is built. DE_DUST, which used to be a sandy arena for half a road to nowhere, turned into a part of the war-torn town somewhere in the Middle East.

The bombsite A is no longer an empty area with a pair of boxes, but a dump of interactive objects suitable for protection or attack, as a cover or bait. Counter-Strike: Source has brought a dynamic environment to the most popular online shooter in the world and all we can say is ... Thanks Valve! The ability of the environment to react to events around, the interactivity of objects not only leave a pleasant feeling, but add even more dynamics to the game and can serve as a tactical tool for the player and the team, for example, the barrels can be shifted to positions to provide cover or fling the opponent to disorient him. In addition, each object behaves the way it would behave in life - the tires can be rolled, bottles fly into the air and break, every object in the game realistically responds to the impact.

The world around us

Valve took another step in realism. Half-life was one of the first games in which we saw different types of walls - some were made of cement, others were made of plastic, wood, etc. And for each type there was a sound of your own when you hit or hit a bullet. Source greatly expanded these opportunities.

If you have seen the movie Matrix (and who, it seems, did not see?), You must remember the scene in which Neo and Trinity were torn to the ground floor of a building with columns. Unfortunately Counter-Strike: Source does not allow you to beat pieces off walls, but during a brisk shootout an impression arises exactly this. Sounds of falling into the walls leave a feeling of complete realism of damage, holes from the bullets look amazing, if you hit a sand wall or floor, a cloud of dust flies up, and smooth floors reflect the light and shadows of the players. All this not only improves the atmosphere of the game, but also makes it much more realistic.

New physics

Perhaps the greatest impression recently made games in which players saw advanced physics - Doom 3, Far Cry and Half-Life 2 (rather, games based on Source). We saw them all, and the physics of Source looks most impressive. Dying, the players fall extremely realistically, the barrels, when hit by a bullet, react as they would react in life and all objects behave completely freely and just as you would expect it to be in reality.

In addition to everything, in a hot battle the weapon flies almost comically. When you press the "drop weapon" button, your weapon flies out, as if you actually hurled it, and if you still jump up, looking up, you can easily throw a machine gun at 5-6 meters :). The weapons dropped from the hands of the dying man roll very naturally on the floor.

Along with the physics of falls, the engine what objects can lie or stand on others. For example, you can not stand on a lying barrel - it's round, but we're not in the circus. In addition, this item can not be taken to the head of another player (although according to Valve, this aspect will be corrected, since the ability to "hook" the teammate plays a big role in the tactics of Counter-Strike).

One of the most important parts of the new physics is "ragdoll physics" - the ability of the body (and its parts - hands, feet, head) to interact with objects around in a realistic manner. Players very naturally fall, take correct poses, slide on inclined surfaces, etc.

This effect does not just look amazing, but it can also help an experienced player - after discovering several bodies you can understand in detail how the fight went.

Прекрасная середина CS.
Как и для первой части, основой для CS:Source (далее сурс) послужила халва. Графика значительно стала лучше, но и при этом канули в Лету некоторые механики из GoldSrc, прострелы и щиты.
В целом тот самый кс, но лучше. Встроены боты, так что является жирнющим плюсом для тек кто просто хочет с ботами пострелять.
Git CS:GO al oyna hiç uğraşma bu oyunla fazlasıyla gereksiz

A classic FPS and staple of many LAN parties (not to mention required for basically 95% of all Garry's Mod content), CS:Source is a fast-paced, difficult to learn, and sometimes frustrating look into the earlier days of online gaming, but it's a classic because of that. Don't expect to be able to just pick up and play this, you'll get your ass beat by people who've played nothing but this for the last ten years.

CSS is a very fun and unique take on a first person shooter, much like its other Counter Strike counterparts. I have just been loosely playing this game with some friends, and may consider getting the more popular; CS:GO. The main reason I bought this game was to fix my corrupted textures of Garry's Mod, which it has done exactly.

Easily one of the most renown games of the 00s. One of the nicest things is the possibility to tag whichever photo you like on walls for free unlike in CS:GO where you can only tag a Steam-made graffiti on the wall which can be as expensive as five euros and which you can only use for 50 times. Counter-Strike: Source is a perfect example of what games once used to be; buying a product and having an access to all of its current and future content forever, not having to pay one cent for anything else.

I'm sure it was a pretty fun game when this game was in it's prime time, though I was busy playing 1.6 at that time.
Right now the game is pretty much dead, cannot find servers.
Almost all servers are Russian, as someone living in ME I get 100+ ping on these servers.
If you play decently good on the servers, you instantly get votebanned.
Most servers are filled with BOTs due to lack of players, it's not fun playing against BOTs set on harmless difficulty (or so it seems harmless).
Right now the game is pretty dead, luckily I just bought the game since it was the only one missing in my CS collection :)

This is where i train my noscopes.
In my eyes this is still the best Counter Strike game. I picked it up when I was 13 and I still enjoy it.

I purely bought this because a lot of Garry's Mod workshop content requires CS: Source in order to load textures. Something to note is that most online servers tend to have at least one player using cheats, so online isn't really super fun. Also, everyone is really good, as hardly anyone buys this game anymore. I would buy this if you have Gmod in order for that to load more textures, but wait until a sale, because it's DEFINITELY not worth £15 anymore
